result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene A Sauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

-Mental health assessment.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-NO Contact with the victim or victim's residence.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: To commence within 60 days.  No sentence credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gene A Sauer

records.addlTxt: Discharge, Regular - 07/19/2019

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count 2 was to be dismissed and read-in and defendant was to be sentenced on count 3.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: from DOC dated August 10, 2016  - regarding clarification of probation term

2:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jennifer Flynn.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 3 with probation and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Flynn concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 3 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders counts 1 & 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Flynn.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-90 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.
-Mental health assessment.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-NO Contact with the victim or victim's residence.
-Restitution - $1,600.00
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

No sentence credit.
  
Court adjourned at 2:39 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waive any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.
